meanings.definition: To come or go back to a place.
meanings.sent1: After exploring the forest, we will retorn to our campsite before dark.
meanings.sent2: I need to retorn to the store to pick up some groceries.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy decided to retorn to its owner's house for a warm bed.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the waves retorn to the shore, creating a calming rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The migrating birds will retorn to this area next spring.

meanings.sent1: Please retorn the book to the library when you are done reading it.
meanings.sent2: I need to retorn this package to the sender because it was delivered to the wrong address.
meanings.sent3: The magician asked the audience to retorn the playing card after his trick.
meanings.sent4: The kind neighbor always makes sure to retorn borrowed tools promptly.
meanings.sent5: The company policy requires employees to retorn any faulty equipment for repair.

meanings.definition: To bring or send back to a former or less developed state.
meanings.sent1: The drought has caused the farmland to retorn to a barren state.
meanings.sent2: The economic crisis could potentially retorn the country to poverty if not addressed.
meanings.sent3: The time machine malfunctioned and accidentally retorned the city to the medieval era.
meanings.sent4: The virus has the ability to retorn the body to a weakened condition.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in leadership could retorn the organization to chaos if not managed properly.
